briefTitle: SPY-X: A Study to Assess the Feasibility of Using SPY Alone for Sentinel Node Localization for Melanoma or Breast Cancer
officialTitle: SPY-X: A Study to Assess the Feasibility of Using Real-time Fluorescence Lymphangiography Alone for Sentinel Node Localization in Patients With Melanoma or Breast Cancer

arms.label: Patients with Melanoma or Breast Cancer

summary: The objective of this study is to determine if fluorescence lymphangiography can be used alone to localize sentinel nodes in patients with melanoma or breast cancer. The hypothesis is that sentinel nodes can be identified using only indocyanine green (ICG) and fluorescence lymphangiography, without the need for technetium99 and a gamma probe.

primaryOutcome.measure: Number of Participants Where the First, Second and Third Sentinel Nodes Localized With the Use of Fluorescence Imaging Alone

effectByArm.arm: Patients With Melanoma or Breast Cancer
